channel.title: The Driver's Edge Photo Gallery
channel.description: Scroll through photos of the latest and greatest photos from the automotive industry

item.title: GENESIS’ ESSENTIA IS AN ELECTRIC GT WITH AN AWESOMELY RETRO-FUTURISTIC ‘BUBBLE’ ROOF
item.author: Verge
item.description: An all-electric coupe for your imagined retro-future

media:content.media:title: Genesis Essentia Electric GT
media:content.media:description: Anyone who grew up on dog-eared copies of Popular Science probably assumed we’d be riding around in self-driving cars while viewing the passing scenery through glass or plastic bubble roofs.

media:content.media:title: Genesis Essentia Electric GT
media:content.media:description: The self-driving car part is playing out right now, but the glass or plastic bubble part seems to have been left in the recycling bin.

media:content.media:title: Genesis Essentia Electric GT
media:content.media:description: Now, here’s the Genesis Essentia, an all-electric performance concept with a transparent hood and a fully retro-futuristic bubble roof.

media:content.media:title: Genesis Essentia Electric GT
media:content.media:description: The Essentia, which made its global debut at the New York International Auto Show Wednesday, is stunning and sexy.

media:content.media:title: Genesis Essentia Electric GT
media:content.media:description: The Essentia, which made its global debut at the New York International Auto Show Wednesday, is stunning and sexy.

media:content.media:title: Genesis Essentia Electric GT
media:content.media:description: And it has all the fanciful hallmarks of a concept befitting the luxury branding: super-lightweight, low-slung, carbon-fiber monocoque body; butterfly doors that are opened with a fingerprint sensor or biometric facial recognition; and a battery-powered motor that Genesis says can sprint to 60 mph in three seconds.

media:content.media:title: Genesis Essentia Electric GT
media:content.media:description: This is Genesis’ first electric vehicle, but there’s no word on if and when the Essentia will enter production.

media:content.media:title: Genesis Essentia Electric GT
media:content.media:description: The concept clearly is Genesis’ effort to match pace with supercars like BMW’s i8 and Mercedes-Benz’s Project One.

media:content.media:title: Genesis Essentia Electric GT
media:content.media:description: Last year, the Hyundai-owned automaker unveiled a hydrogen-powered luxury SUV, the GV80.

item.title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
item.author: Motor1
item.description: It’s here – the all-new Honda Insight. Following the debut of the prototype in Detroit, Honda is finally showing off its handsome new hybrid in the sheet metal. Scheduled for an official showing at the New York Auto Show in just a few days, Honda’s latest entry into its growing fleet of electrified vehicles is also one of its most advanced.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: Borrowing a number of design cues from the rest of the Honda range, including the "flying wing" grille, the low-profile LED headlights and taillights, and the coupe-like roofline, the Insight will be positioned (and priced) between the smaller Civic and the larger Accord.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: Borrowing a number of design cues from the rest of the Honda range, including the "flying wing" grille, the low-profile LED headlights and taillights, and the coupe-like roofline, the Insight will be positioned (and priced) between the smaller Civic and the larger Accord.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: An efficient two-motor hybrid powertrain, similar to the one found on the Accord Hybrid, comes under the hood. A 1.5-liter gas engine paired to an electric propulsion motor and a lithium ion battery pack delivers 151 horsepower (112 kilowatts) and 197 pound-feet (267 Newton-meters) of torque.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: With three driving modes available – Normal, Econ, and Sport – the new Insight has the ability to return up to 55 miles per gallon in the city.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: "The Honda Insight shows consumers that the efficiency of a hybrid car doesn't mean sacrificing style, refinement or performance," said Henio Arcangeli, Jr., senior vice president of American Honda Motor Co., Inc. "The Insight is another symbol of a new era in the evolution of Honda electrified vehicles, where customers can have everything they want with no compromises."

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: In the cabin, the Insight will come with an eight-inch touchscreen system and available Apple CarPlay and Android Auto integration, with standard Honda Sensing technology.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: The suite of safety systems, including things like forward collision warning, collision mitigation braking, adaptive cruise control, and traffic sign recognition, will be available on all trims, with upper-trim EX and Touring models also gaining Honda LaneWatch.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: The new Insight will be built alongside the Civic and CR-V at Honda’s facility in Greensburg, Indiana, while the hybrid battery and 1.5-liter gas engine will be built in Ohio.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: The former will come out of Honda’s Marysville plant, while the latter will manufactured at the Anna, Ohio facility. No word on pricing or availability just yet.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: The former will come out of Honda’s Marysville plant, while the latter will manufactured at the Anna, Ohio facility. No word on pricing or availability just yet.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: The former will come out of Honda’s Marysville plant, while the latter will manufactured at the Anna, Ohio facility. No word on pricing or availability just yet.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: The former will come out of Honda’s Marysville plant, while the latter will manufactured at the Anna, Ohio facility. No word on pricing or availability just yet.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: The former will come out of Honda’s Marysville plant, while the latter will manufactured at the Anna, Ohio facility. No word on pricing or availability just yet.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Honda Insight Is A Handsom Hybrid With Up To 55 MPG City
media:content.media:description: The former will come out of Honda’s Marysville plant, while the latter will manufactured at the Anna, Ohio facility. No word on pricing or availability just yet.

channel.item:
2019 Audi A7 Sportback Photo Shoot in Oslo
https://www.motor1.com/news/235470/audi-a7-new-images-video/ Adrian Padeanu
The droopy derrière that made the first A7 Sportback stand out among other Audis is now a thing of the past as the new generation comes with a completely reworked rear end.
Thu, 08 Mar 2018 11:57:00 Z
2019 Audi A7 Sportback Photo Shoot in Oslo
Audi The A6’s more athletic cousin embraces the company’s new design language that started with the flagship A8 with which it shares many of the styling cues, but with an emphasis on a more dynamic shape to put the sport in Sportback.
©
2019 Audi A7 Sportback Photo Shoot in Oslo
Audi Motor1.com friend Auditography had the privilege of being the first to immortalize the A7 following the model’s official debut back in the second half of October 2017. The subject of his photo shoot conducted in Oslo, Norway at freezing temperatures of -13 degrees Celsius (8.6 degrees Fahrenheit) was an elegant black example in the 55 TFSI Quattro flavor as per Audi’s new controversial nomenclature.
2019 Audi A7 Sportback Photo Shoot in Oslo
Audi Going up against the all-new Mercedes CLS and the aging BMW 6 Series Gran Coupe, the A7 bets on being a technological tour de force wrapped in a sleek body to lure in customers looking for a four-door model with a practical tailgate.
2019 Audi A7 Sportback Photo Shoot in Oslo
Audi It has just about the same bells and whistles as the A8 (and the new A6 Sedan), including Audi’s new approach towards the user interface with dual touchscreen displays dominating the center console and complementing the second-generation of the “Virtual Cockpit.”
2019 Audi A7 Sportback Photo Shoot in Oslo
Audi Those looking for a sportier take on the A7 will have to patiently wait for the hotter S7 seen at the beginning of the month with virtually no camouflage, thus suggesting an official reveal might occur in the near future.
2019 Audi A7 Sportback Photo Shoot in Oslo
Audi Further down the line, the crown jewel of the range will once again be the RS7, caught a few months ago with its RS-specific oval exhaust tips hiding underneath a test mule of the regular model.
2019 Audi A7 Sportback Photo Shoot in Oslo
Polestar Motor1.com friend Auditography had the privilege of being the first to immortalize the A7 following the model’s official debut back in the second half of October 2017. The subject of his photo shoot conducted in Oslo, Norway at freezing temperatures of -13 degrees Celsius (8.6 degrees Fahrenheit) was an elegant black example in the 55 TFSI Quattro flavor as per Audi’s new controversial nomenclature.

item.title: 2019 Polestar 1 Makes Geneva Debut in Matte Grey
item.author: Arman Barari
item.description: 2018 Geneva Motor Show marks the launch of a world tour for the all-new 2019 Polestar 1.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Polestar 1 at the 2018 Geneva Motor Show
media:content.media:description: 2018 Geneva Motor Show marks the launch of a world tour for the all-new 2019 Polestar 1, the Swedish electric sports car created by Volvo’s former tuner and racing partner.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Polestar 1 at the 2018 Geneva Motor Show
media:content.media:description: The car arrived in Geneva wearing a dope matte grey paint job.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Polestar 1 at the 2018 Geneva Motor Show
media:content.media:description: Throughout the year it will visit other major motor shows around the world, presumably in even doper colors.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Polestar 1 at the 2018 Geneva Motor Show
media:content.media:description: But if you fancy one of these things you don’t have to wait all year to put your name down. Polestar will start accepting -pre-orders for the 1 starting from March 13. All you have to secure one for yourself is pay a fully-refundable deposit of €2,500.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Polestar 1 at the 2018 Geneva Motor Show
media:content.media:description: Just like the new Volvo XC40, the The Polestar 1 consumer experience is based on a new subscription model, where customers will be able to subscribe to their Polestar car for two or three years.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Polestar 1 at the 2018 Geneva Motor Show
media:content.media:description: As for the specs, the car is a powerhouse with 600 horsepower and over 1,000 Nm of torque, but the range is only 150 km which is not very good.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Polestar 1 at the 2018 Geneva Motor Show
media:content.media:description: Electromobility is the main focus of today’s automotive industry, and Polestar is at the centre of this development, introducing world-class electrified cars and ground-breaking, customer-focussed services and offers.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Polestar 1 at the 2018 Geneva Motor Show
media:content.media:description: Electromobility is the main focus of today’s automotive industry, and Polestar is at the centre of this development, introducing world-class electrified cars and ground-breaking, customer-focussed services and offers.

item.title: 2019 Volvo V60 Is A Classy Wagon That Doesn't Skimp On Practicality
item.author: Tyler Heatley
item.description: Offering style and substance, the new midsize premium wagon is ready to give the Germans a hard time.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: It’s a looker isn’t it? Unlike dominant German rivals, the V60 ditches sharp creases in favor of flowing lines and generally more sculpted physique. Volvo’s signature Thor hammerhead headlights make a return on this wagon, as does a broad chromed grille. Overall the car presents a sophisticated and elegant alternative to SUV alternatives.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Volvo v60 Wagon Revealed
media:content.media:description: Inside you’ll find a cabin that won’t be mistaken for an Audi or BMW. A minimalist design comes curtesy of a large portrait touchscreen that has absorbed most of the switchgear. Air conditioning, navigation, media, it’s all housed in this 9.0-inch display. Swedish style flows into the rear where passengers will find good levels of head and leg room, although the middle occupant will have to contend with a sizeable transmission hump.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Volvo v60 Wagon Revealed
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Volvo v60 Wagon Revealed
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon

What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: Volvo is aiming for all of its cars to feature some form of electrification by 2019 and so the new V60 has two gasoline plug-in hybrid options. The most potent T8 hybrid produces 385 horsewpoer. There’s also a range of conventional gasoline and diesel engines to accompany the plug-in cars.

What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: Practicality is a high priority for any estate car and so this V60 is equipped with a large trunk and flat load bay. 529 liters of space makes it 99 liters bigger than the outgoing car, and actually more spacious than a BMW 3 Series Touring, Audi A4 Avant, and Mercedes-Benz C-Class Estate. Fold the rear seats flat to grant 1,364 liters of cargo space.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: Practicality is a high priority for any estate car and so this V60 is equipped with a large trunk and flat load bay. 529 liters of space makes it 99 liters bigger than the outgoing car, and actually more spacious than a BMW 3 Series Touring, Audi A4 Avant, and Mercedes-Benz C-Class Estate. Fold the rear seats flat to grant 1,364 liters of cargo space.

Fold the rear seats flat to grant 1,364 liters of cargo space.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: Volvo is well known for its safety tech and so the V60 is packed with its latest advances. City Safe will automatically apply the brakes if it detects an imminent collision and the semi-autonomous Pilot Assist system will keep you in your lane. With all that, in tandem with a vast array of airbags, we’d expect the V60 to claim the full five stars from Euro NCA

item.title: Ferrari 488 Pista Officially Revealed With More Power, Less Weight
item.author: Adrian Padeanu
item.description: After a couple of massive leaks, the Ferrari 488 Pista is finally here to steer you away from buying a Porsche 911 GT2 RS.

item.title: 2018 BMW X2 First Look: Not So Fastback
item.author: Collin Woodard
item.description: A "new breed of car" that sure looks a lot like a small crossover

media:content.media:title: 2018 BMW X2
media:content.media:description: It’s been about two years since we first saw a disguised BMW X2 prototype on the road. Since then, it’s been teased relentlessly and even caught essentially undisguised. Today, though, BMW officially revealed the X2.

media:content.media:title: 2018 BMW X2
media:content.media:description: It’s been about two years since we first saw a disguised BMW X2 prototype on the road. Since then, it’s been teased relentlessly and even caught essentially undisguised. Today, though, BMW officially revealed the X2.

item.title: 2019 Volkswagen Arteon: Chicago 2018
item.author: Drew Phillips
item.description: We’ve been admiring the good looks of Volkswagen’s CC replacement, the Arteon, for nearly a year now—from afar, that is. But now VW has finally announced U.S.-market information for the 2019 Arteon, and it doesn’t appear to be at all dumbed down compared to the Europe-market version that has been on sale for a while now.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Volkswagen Arteon: Chicago 2018
media:content.media:description: We’ve been admiring the good looks of Volkswagen’s CC replacement, the Arteon, for nearly a year now—from afar, that is. But now VW has finally announced U.S.-market information for the 2019 Arteon, and it doesn’t appear to be at all dumbed down compared to the Europe-market version that has been on sale for a while now.

item.title: Lamborghini Launches Urus SUV, Gives It 641 HP To Play With
item.author: Sergiu Tudose
item.description: Lamborghini has officially re-entered the SUV sector, as their brand new, high-performance Urus SUV looks ready slay any and all opponents in its segment.

media:content.media:title: Lamborghini Launches Urus SUV
media:content.media:description: With 641 HP and 627 lb-ft (850 Nm) of torque at its disposal, the Lamborghini Urus is able to hit 62 mph (100 km/h) in 3.6 seconds, 124 mph (200 km/h) in 12.8 seconds, and a top speed of 190 mph (305 km/h). A plug-in hybrid option will be available later on.

media:content.media:title: Lamborghini Launches Urus SUV
media:content.media:description: With 641 HP and 627 lb-ft (850 Nm) of torque at its disposal, the Lamborghini Urus is able to hit 62 mph (100 km/h) in 3.6 seconds, 124 mph (200 km/h) in 12.8 seconds, and a top speed of 190 mph (305 km/h). A plug-in hybrid option will be available later on.

item.title: New Toyota FT-AC Concept Is A Macho Compact SUV For Adventurers
item.author: Carscoops
item.description: Toyota has revealed the Future Toyota Adventure Concept (FT-AC) at the LA Auto Show, a design study aiming at people looking for a proper rugged crossover. Described as a design study for now, the new Toyota FT-AC is imagined as a gasoline-powered SUV with an advanced torque-vectoring all-wheel-drive system, and the company adding that it could switch to a next-generation hybrid system.

item.title: 2018 Mazda6 Gets 250 HP Turbo Treatment, New Interior For LA Debut
item.author: Christopher Smith
item.description: Mazda says the new Mazda6 is re-engineered, but looking at the company’s 2018 flagship sedan, it doesn’t seem much different than the outgoing model. It’s true that, at a glance, it’s the same attractive mid-sizer turning the front wheels, with stats that still match up to the outgoing model. That is, all stats save for the one labeled horsepower, provided you opt for the new SKYACTIV-G 2.5 T engine. In case you’re wondering, the T stands for turbo.

media:content.media:description: Mazda debuted the new Mazda6 at LAAS. It is set for production and release beginning in 2018.

item.title: Top-of-the-line 2018 Buick Regal TourX costs $43,795
item.author: Drew Phillips
item.description: Buick has unveiled an online configurator for the 2018 Regal TourX wagon, and it shows that picking the full suite of premium options puts the sport wagon at $43,795. That prices it under its Regal GS Sportback sibling and competitors like the Volvo V60 Cross Country and Audi A4 Allroad. The luxury hatchback starts at $29,995 and is available in three trim options: TourX 1SV, Preferred ($33,575) and Essence ($35,945). All are powered by a 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder engine that puts out 250 horsepower and 295 pound-feet of torque and drives an eight-speed automatic transmission. Intelligent all-wheel-drive with active twin-clutch, start-stop technology and 18-inch painted aluminum wheels are also standard.

item.title: 2019 Corvette ZR1 Convertible Is Rightfully One Of LA’s Hottest Debuts
item.author: Drew Phillips
item.description: General Motors' 755-horsepower Corvette ZR1 supercar will have a starting price of $119,995, with the convertible version from $123,995, its global product development chief, Mark Reuss, said on Tuesday.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Corvette ZR1 is GMs 755-horsepower supervette
media:content.media:description: General Motors' 755-horsepower Corvette ZR1 supercar will have a starting price of $119,995, with the convertible version from $123,995, its global product development chief, Mark Reuss, said on Tuesday.

item.title: 2019 Mercedes-Benz CLS revives the straight six
item.author: Joel Stocksdale
item.description: It's finally here, the third generation of the car that popularized the four-door coupe design, the Mercedes-Benz CLS. This 2019 model replaces the version that first appeared in production form way back in 2010. Compared with that car, the new CLS looks much cleaner and leaner. The look-at-me rear fender creases have vanished, the nose and tail straightened out, and the extra-wide grille and lights sit low in the front fascia. What remains is a high belt line and rakish roof. Overall, it might be a tad less distinctive, but more mature.

media:content.media:title: The New 2019 Mercedes-Benz CLS
media:content.media:description: The new CLS looks much cleaner and leaner. The look-at-me rear fender creases have vanished, the nose and tail straightened out, and the extra-wide grille and lights sit low in the front fascia. What remains is a high belt line and rakish roof. Overall, it might be a tad less distinctive, but more mature.

What remains is a high belt line and rakish roof. Overall, it might be a tad less distinctive, but more mature.

The look-at-me rear fender creases have vanished, the nose and tail straightened out, and the extra-wide grille and lights sit low in the front fascia. What remains is a high belt line and rakish roof. Overall, it might be a tad less distinctive, but more mature.
